document.heading: District of Columbia Child Placing Authority Act Amendments Act of 1982

history.narrative: Law 4-141, the “District of Columbia Child Placing Authority Act Amendments Act of 1982,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 4-164, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 25, 1982, and June 8, 1982, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 30, 1982, it was assigned Act No. 4-207 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
